DiskCleanup.description: Opens the Disk Cleanup utility to clean temporary files, system files, and more.

SystemFileChecker.description: Scans and repairs system files to fix corrupted files.

CheckDiskErrors.description: Checks and repairs disk errors on the C: drive.

DefragmentDisk.description: Optimizes the performance of the hard drive by defragmenting it.

DisableStartupPrograms.description: Displays the list of startup programs to identify and disable unnecessary ones.

ClearSystemCache.description: Clears system and user cache files to free up space.

ReindexSpotlight.description: Reindexes Spotlight to improve search speed and accuracy.

VerifyDisk.description: Verifies the integrity of the disk and repairs any errors.

FreeUpStorage.description: Removes old log files to free up disk space.

ResetSMC.command: For Intel Macs: Hold Shift + Control + Option + power button for 10 seconds. For M1 Macs: Shut down and restart the Mac.
ResetSMC.description: Resets the System Management Controller (SMC) to improve system performance.

UpdateSystemPackages.command: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
UpdateSystemPackages.description: Updates system packages to the latest versions (for Debian-based systems).

CleanPackageCache.description: Cleans the package cache to free up space (for Debian-based systems).

RemoveUnusedPackages.command: sudo apt autoremove -y && sudo apt autoclean -y
RemoveUnusedPackages.description: Removes unnecessary packages and cleans up the system (for Debian-based systems).

FreeUpMemory.description: Frees up memory by clearing cached data.

DefragmentDisk.description: Defragments the disk (for ext4 file systems, only necessary for HDDs).

CheckDiskUsage.description: Displays the disk usage and available space across mounted file systems.
